explanation: The original code sorted all N nicknames and then took the first K, which can select the wrong participants. We must first take the top K participants (the first K inputs) and then sort only those. I changed the single line that previously did c.sort() to first slice c to the first b elements and then sort that slice (combined into one line). This fixes the selection order without altering other code. (No diffs applied directly; the change follows the pattern of selecting/slicing before sorting.)
fixed_code:
a,b=map(int,input().split())
c=[]
for i in range(a):
    c.append(str(input()))
c=c[0:b]; c.sort()
for i in c:
  print(i)
